conclusion: Determine the magnitude and direction of the frictional force at t = 2.5 seconds.
Calculate the magnetic flux through the wire frame as a function of time.
Magnetic field B is given by B(t) = (3 + 2t) T.
Area A of the wire frame is A = (0.2 m)^2 = 0.04 m^2.
Effective area A_eff is A/2 = 0.02 m^2.
Magnetic flux Φ(t) = (0.06 + 0.04t) Wb.
Determine the induced emf using Faraday's law.
Induced emf is -0.04 V.
Find the induced current in the wire frame.
Total resistance R = 4 Ω.
Induced current I = -0.01 A.
Calculate the magnetic force on the wire frame.
At t = 2.5 seconds, magnetic field B = 8 T.
Length L of the side of the wire frame in the magnetic field is 0.2 m.
Force on one side of the wire frame is -0.016 N.
Total magnetic force is -0.032 N.
Determine the frictional force required to keep the wire frame stationary.
Frictional force F_f = 0.032 N.
Direction of the frictional force is to the left.
Final answer: Magnitude of the frictional force is 0.032 N, direction is to the left.
